sentence.Network_en: The car park was absolutely packed solid with people.
sentence.Network_cn: 停车场被人挤得水泄不通。

sentence.Network_en: There are thousands of students absolutely gagging to come to this university.
sentence.Network_cn: 肯定有成千上万的学生都渴望到这所大学念书。

sentence.Network_en: "I absolutely hated school," Rachel says. "I skived off all the time."
sentence.Network_cn: “我恨透了学校，”雷切尔说，“我总是逃学。”

example.ex: I absolutely refuse to get married...

entry.def: Some people say absolutely as an emphatic way of saying yes or of agreeing with someone. They say absolutely not as an emphatic way of saying no or of disagreeing with someone.

example.tran: “他们找过你了吗？”——“没有，绝对没有。”

means.word_mean: 1. completely and without qualification; used informally as intensifiers;

sentences.sentence: "you can be dead sure of my innocence"
"we are absolutely opposed to the idea"
"he forced himself to lie absolutely still"

auth_sentence.content: I had absolutely no hesitation in accepting this role.
auth_sentence.res_content: I had absolutely no hesitation in accepting this role.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I had absolutely no hesitation in accepting this role.

auth_sentence.content: This is absolutely world class work at your doorstep.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is absolutely world class work at your doorstep.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is absolutely world class work at your doorstep.

auth_sentence.content: This is, of course, absolutely no problem.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is, of course, absolutely no problem.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is, of course, absolutely no problem.

stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+solut溶解+e→溶解开来→没有限制→放荡的
absolute[adj.绝对的,完全的;确实的,肯定的]+ly表副词→adv.完全地, 绝对地
absolute[adj.绝对的,完全的;确实的,肯定的]+ism主义→absolutism
resolute[adj.坚决的,果断的]+ion表名词→n.坚决,决心;决定,决议

Sentence.sentence: And despite what you may believe about the limits of your own creative imaginations, we all have the potential to imagine the world in an absolutely new way.
To be absolutely safe, Juan asked his roommate, who was not a geology major, to listen to the speech.
I need to be by myself certainly, absolutely.

sentences.en: Lucy is absolutely devoted to her cats.
sentences.cn: 露西全身心地爱着她的猫。

sentences.en: At the end of a day’s teaching, her nerves were absolutely shattered.
sentences.cn: 教了一天课，她精疲力竭。

sentences.en: We’re absolutely obedient to the superior.
All these knives are absolutely lethal.
sentences.cn: 这些刀都是绝对致命的。

sentences.en: Don’t worry. Your voice sounds absolutely fine.
sentences.cn: 别担心，你的声音听起来非常好。

sentences.en: After all the changes of policy,I’d believe absolutely anything of that man.
sentences.cn: 经过了最近策略的反复更改,我绝对相信那人什么花样都会使得出来。

sentences.en: All the car parks are absolutely full.
sentences.cn: 所有的停车场都停满了车。

means.word_mean: (用于否定结构，表示强调)绝，丝毫

sentences.en: He has absolutely no morals, that man!
Classical music leaves me absolutely cold, but I love rock.
sentences.cn: 古典音乐一点也引不起我的兴趣,我喜欢搖滾乐。

sentences.en: He doesn’t love me any more and there’s absolutely nothing I can do about it.It’s just one of those things.
sentences.cn: 他不再爱我,对此我也无能为力,这是没有办法的事。

means.word_mean: <口>[用以强调，表示毫无保留、无条件赞同完全正确，一点不错
